details.description: Refugees who came to the UK as part of the Kindertransport may be eligible for an increased State Pension because of recent changes in the law
details.body:
You can apply to have your UK insurance record for years before 1948 removed from your pension record if this will make you eligible for a higher German state pension.

In the the early 1990s Germany changed their pension laws to give Kindertransportees a German state pension. However, for many Kindertransportees their new German state pension was affected by their UK insurance record for years before 1948.

Since 2008, you can have these years removed if this will make you eligible for a higher German state pension.

Eligibility

You might be eligible if all of these apply:

  • you came to the UK before June 1940 as part of the Kindertransport
  • you paid into UK State Pension insurance before 1948
  • your entitlement to a German state pension was reduced or lost by the UK State Pension insurance paid before 6 April 1948

If you think you may be eligible, you can ask the International Pension Centre to amend your UK State Pension insurance. This will not affect the UK State Pension you get.

If the Kindertransportee has died, surviving wives or husbands might also be able to benefit. Children could benefit, depending on how long ago their parent died.

How to apply

If you think you may be eligible, contact the International Pension Centre.
